dcterms:description: Foursquare tips are comments left by customers about restaurants and other, usually commercial, establishments. A large proportion of these describe aspects of the establishment, and provide recommendations about what the customer enjoyed (or otherwise). We extracted from the web 1.1M tips relating to establishments in North America.
dcterms:title: Foursquare

dcterms:description: We collected a 23M general dataset of 3-turn conversations from Twitter. This serves as a background dataset not associated with facts, and its massive size is key to learning the conversational structure or backbone.
dcterms:title: Twitter

dcterms:description: Approximately 1 million two-turn conversations that contain entities that tie to Foursquare. We refer to this as the 1M grounded dataset, specifically identifying conversation pairs in which the first turn contained either a handle of the business name or a hashtag that matched a handle.
dcterms:title: 1M grounded dataset (derived from Twitter)

dcterms:description: A dataset of general-domain conversations from Twitter, used to augment the grounded dataset with facts relevant to each conversation history.
dcterms:title: General-domain conversations from Twitter

dcterms:description: Grounded Conversation Datasets augment the 1M grounded dataset with facts relevant to each conversation history, filtering for relevance to the input.
dcterms:title: Grounded Conversation Datasets
